headline: POLL: Gibbons, Mandel lead Ohio GOP Senate primary field
sentences:
POLL: Gibbons, Mandel lead Ohio GOP Senate primary field

The Hill ^ | March 8 | BY TAL AXELROD

Posted on by RandFan

Mike Gibbons and Josh Mandel lead the Ohio GOP Senate primary field as Republicans battle for the chance to run for the seat being vacated by Sen.

To: bigdaddy45

Ever since SOS John Husted required the purging of dead & dormant voters off the voter rolls, The Democrat machines of Cuyahoga, Lorain & Mahoning Counties have been unable to manufacture enough votes to get even ONE Democrat elected state wide.

After being stuck in the middle of the field for months, Gibbons surged to the lead in a The Hill/Emerson College poll released last month and an internal poll conducted by a pro-Vance super PAC released earlier this month.

You can vote in person a few weeks early or by mail, but MUST show ID & by mail list a signature & either the last 4 digits of your SS# or your full DL or State ID #.

“Hillbilly Elegy” author JD Vance is in third with 11 percent, followed by former Ohio GOP Chair Jane Timken at 9 percent and state Sen. Matt Dolan at 7 percent.

by 8 posted onby griswold3 (When chaos serves the State, the State will encourage chaos)

To: RandFan

I don’t think either of them have the look of a winner.
There is only one Democrat that holds any state elected office & that is Sherrod Browne of the US Senate & his time is uo in the next Senatorial Cycle.
He did a good job at the state level & would have beaten Sherrod Brown had he not dropped out last minute due to his wife’s health.
Mandel, a former state treasurer, trails just behind with 20 percent, a difference that falls within the survey’s margin of error.
Gibbons’s polling spike is likely in part due to an advertising blitz that he’s largely funded with millions of his own money.

Vance is clearly a Decepticon, and I don’t see this Gibbons guy as having any track record at all.
